This game is a truly a Steam classic. Killing Floor's simple yet addictive gameplay has thrust it into a position of infamy among the Steam community, and rightfully so. Despite its dated graphics and engine, Killing Floor consistently manages to deliver a intense co-op survival horror experience. Killing Floor is one of the few games of this generation that manages to present the mundane and overused concept of zombies in a refreshing and enticing manner. Fans of this game will certainly be playnig it for years to come. It was worth the dosh.

Overall though, an amazing game to play with a few of your friends.

This. This game is where multiplayer survival goes perfectly. It has all the right chemistry to be an extremely fun and engaging game while at the same time keeping you hooked, and thriving on it's endless replayability. It has no deep background story or singleplayer campaign, but its more like one of those games you play for your daily dose of fun and sense of challenge (well, depending how hard the difficulty of your choosing). Left 4 Dead just does not compare, even if you're not exactly fighting "zombies".

The downloadable content doesnt make anyone more powerful than the other, and theres absolutely limitless freedom in it in how you choose to play. Mostly thanks to the community, theres tons of easy to access custom maps, weapons, or even complete overhauls to the game. All you have to do is download it. I love this game so much, and I dont think ill ever get tired of it even after I've finished maxing out the levels of all my perks.

My ONLY griefs with this game is that they need a little bit more weapon variety. They recently let in a bunch of weapons made by the community, and i can understand balancing issues, but I feel as if theres always room for more. Also, the characters you play as have some pretty strong cockney accents. It makes it a bit hard for me to take some things seriously in the game when someone's speaking in an accent that just sounds plain... humorous.  

Imagine a fierce battle with hundreds of blood thirsty mutants charging in towards the last two survivors of a team that started with six. One of them is barely holding onto life, and the other comes to help him, goofily muttering "I'm tryina heal you, not shag you!". Sometimes the phrases are so cultured and thick accented you can't understand them. I guess it's a matter of getting used to it after a while, but sometimes they can add for some comic relief in the game and I guess serve to remind you not to take it so seriously. Even in the thick of battle. This game is amazing, and you need to buy it.

Fun for so many reasons, and I have much more fun with it than left for dead. Plenty of weapons that satisfy with every shot, flexible difficulty and has a plethora of mods. The leveling system also gives the game more staying power than most zombie shooters I've played. I actually find the game quite relaxing with the right settings aswell.

Over I would say that if you see this game on sale, pick it up fast for a fun time.
A great pick-up game. It's fun to play but becomes repetitive over time. This game gets chosen for Summer and Winter Steam achievements often (something to keep in mind).

A creative twist on your average multiplayer coopertive survival. Sticking together in one spot only works half the time. It's not just a simple "hold up somewhere and shoot anything that moves", it's more of a "keep running and WATCH OUT FOR THAT TRIUMPHANT BASTARD WITH MEAT GRINDERS FOR HANDS" sort-of thing. With an abundance of characters and 6 classes to choose from that boost your skills with certain weapons, Killing Floor is no average survival coopertive. To level up your classes, all you gotta do is kill shit with certain weapons, and not suck at it. These "specimens" come in waves, each harder than the last, eventually leading up to a final boss character, that your whole team (up to 6 players) must work together with all of your power to defeat. Killing Floor is a fun game to play with friends, and is as enjoyable as killing mutated freaks can get.

Zombies? Check. Lots of guns? Check. Class based leveling? Check. I could go on about Killing Floor aka KF because it is such a fun time. I spent hours leveling up each class wanting the next one after the next as I fight through the hordes of different evil creations being finally confronted by there master. It can be casual as well as a challenge. Whichever it is I constantly enjoy destroying my enemies with weapons from chainsaws to Shotguns or dual revolvers to AK47s. The list is massive and the slaughter never stops. One of my personal favorites and I highly recommend KF.
Best team killing game ever.

Teamwork horror survival + perk leveling + zombie-killing. Many classes to try, especially the demo class.

It is as the name implies. You kill stuff with guns. There are different perks that you can level up that give you bonuses that make a huge difference the more you level them. While it is possible to play this solo it is truely designed for co-op gameplay. Not any plot to speak of you just hop into a map and kill stuff till the Patriarch shows up then unleash hell on him before he kills you. Pretty fun game if your looking for a lot of bloody violance.

An excellent game, probably one of the most successful titles to come out of the survival horror genre. Powered by the Unreal 2 Engine, it holds its own surprisingly well when it comes to graphics, it is able to run smoothly on most machines without degrading the graphics settings too much. The variety of the weapons and different skill classes offers a moderately high replay value, however the amount of servers available with decent performance in Australia is pretty saddening, because it is a game that really requires you to play with at least three or four other people to get the full experience. 8.5/10
